newsitem.title: SUDAN: Sudan floods kill at least 100 people.
newsitem.headline: Sudan floods kill at least 100 people.

text.p: More than 100 people have been killed and thousands made homeless by Nile floods and heavy rain in southern Sudan, a Khartoum newspaper said on Wednesday.
The privately-owned Alwan daily said 52 people had died in Lakes state and another 50 in Tonga province in Upper Nile state.
It quoted John Dor, a state minister in the Ministry of Federal Rule Chamber, as saying that heavy rain and floods had displaced 8,000 people in Wau, the capital of Western Bahr al-Ghazal state.
Dor is the chairman of the committee charged with overseeing support for flood victims.
